Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a picture of a plant that has enough water and looks healthy and growing.
The student can draw a picture of a plant that does not have enough water and looks wilted or not growing well.
The student can show the difference between plants with enough water and plants without enough water by comparing their drawings.
The student can use colors and labels to show the effects of water on plants in their drawings.
The student can identify patterns in their drawings by explaining how plants need water to live and grow.
